Description: ASTRA: The suspect in the assassination attempt on Zakhar Prilepin confessed, claims channel 112, owned by the Kremlin Ren-TV. -The man said that he was recruited by one of the Ukrainian special services several years ago. He gave them the information they needed... The accused of the attempt on the life of Zakhar Prilepin is demanded to be sentenced to life imprisonmentAbout this writes -Mediazona- with reference to a correspondent from the hall of the 2nd Western District Military Court.The investigation claims that the accused Alexander Permyakov in 2022 received Ukraine instructions about exploding the car of the writer Zakhar Prilepin and part of the money - two thousand rubles, after which he entered Russia through Latvia and committed an assassination attempt.It is alleged that correspondence with the elder was found on Permyakov‚Äôs phone operative SBU Zhuravkin, with whom Permyakov discussed -the preparation of a terrorist attack, surveillance of Prilepin and his houses, the placement of mines.- From a page on VKontakte under the name Ivanka Polikarpova, Zhuravkin communicated with Prilepin‚Äôs son Ignat and thus found out where the writer would be on the day of the terrorist attack. In addition to a life sentence, the prosecutor's office asks that Permyakov spend the first 10 years of his sentence in prison, and also pay a fine of one and a half million rubles. The prosecutor called the social danger of the crime colossal and noted -strong antisocial attitudes and socially dangerous interests- of the accused. At the same time, Permyakov‚Äôs sister Irina told the investigator during interrogation that while still a schoolchild, her brother was sentenced to 7 years because -he and his friends beat someone.- Four years later, he was released on parole, and in 2015 went -to the DPR militia.- In the spring of 2022, Permyakov moved to the Khmelnitsky region of Ukraine -as a migrant.-Prilepin himself refused to participate in the debate and asked that Permyakov be punished -in accordance with the law.- Permyakov did not speak out in the debate. In May 2023, a bomb was blown up in the Nizhny Novgorod region car by Zakhar Prilepin. As a result, the writer was seriously injured, and his guard Alexander Shubin died on the spot. The Investigative Committee opened a case of terrorism. On the same day, not far from the scene of the assassination attempt, there was detainedAlexander Permyakov. They found on him passports of Russia and Ukraine and a fake passport of Kazakhstan, nearby - a combat pistol with a silencer, a band-aid, five SIM cards, two bank cards, cash rubles and hryvnias, a flashlight, a compass, a flint, and a sheet with ten telephone numbers and names. At the police station, Permyakov admitted to the attempt on Prilepin‚Äôs life, regretting that he did not die.

Title: üñº The mayor of New York was charged with bribery for $100,000. H...
Description: The mayor of New York was charged with bribery for $100,000. He became the first sitting mayor of the city suspected of a criminal offenseThe US Attorney's Office on September 26 indicted the mayor of New York, representative Democratic Party Eric Adams is accused of receiving illegal campaign donations, as well as Turkey's influence on the election of Adams as head of the city, writes Reuters.Adams is charged with the following: - bribery;- two counts of extorting election contributions from foreign citizens;- organizing a fraudulent bank transfer scheme;- illegally receiving contributions from a foreign citizen for an election campaign.It is alleged that while still the head of Brooklyn, Adams traveled for free on a Turkish plane airlines on a trip costing tens of thousands of dollars, and for two nights in a luxurious suite at the St. Regis in Istanbul paid only $600, although he should have paid about $7,000.New York Federal Prosecutor Damian Williams said that the entire amount of the mayor's Turkish leisure, which included hotel stays, yacht excursions and flights business class, reached about $100,000, and Adams, according to Williams, -was required to declare- all expenses. Williams believes that in this way the Turkish authorities tried to gain the mayor's favor in order to later influence his decisions. In addition, Adams also partially financed his 2021 mayoral campaign in New York with donations from Turkey, receiving them through bogus American citizens. Adams, 64, denies wrongdoing and said he will fight the charges in court. He said he will not resign. -I will continue to do my job as mayor,- he said at a news conference in response to calls to resign.Adams, a former police officer, became the first of 110 mayors of New York who was charged with a criminal offense during his stay.

Title: üñº An installation dedicated to Stanislav Petrov, the man who pre...
Description: An installation dedicated to Stanislav Petrov, the man who prevented nuclear war, has appeared in St. PetersburgThe text reads: -The light of the sun's rays reflected from the clouds.- The work is dedicated to the event of 1983: While Petrov was on duty on the night of September 26, 1983, the missile attack warning system in the secret part of Serpukhov-15 in the Moscow region gave a signal - ballistic missiles were launched from US territory rockets. He could have given the order to launch an atomic strike on US territory, but Petrov decided that this was a false alarm of the system and passed the corresponding notification up the chain of command. After the investigation, it turned out that Soviet sensors mistook the light of the sun's rays reflected from the clouds for the launch of an American rocket. The day before, at a meeting of the Russian Security Council on nuclear deterrence, Vladimir Putin proposed to make changes to the doctrine of nuclear deterrence: -In the updated version of the document, aggression against Russia by any non-nuclear state, but with the participation or support nuclear state is proposed to be considered as their joint attack on Russia.-Photo: -Paper-

Description: The Norwegian Ministry of Internal Affairs has put a suspect in the sale on the wanted listpagers HezbollahAbout this reportsReuters. Israeli President Isaac Herzog said that he -unequivocally rejects- the country's connection to the bombing of pagers and walkie-talkies on Hezbollah supporters in Lebanon.

According to the investigation, he and his business partners fraudulently transferred to the Czech Republic provider Reliable Communications the rights to IP addresses that previously belonged to the ANO Russian Research Institute for the Development of Public Networks (RosNIIROS).

Title: üñº A Russian who fled from mobilization was denied political asyl...
Description: A Russian who fled from mobilization was denied political asylum in Norway. The country's authorities referred to Putin's words that the mobilization had ended Pavel Suetin left Severomorsk in the Murmansk region on September 22, 2022 - the day after the mobilization was announced. He came to Norway and requested asylum in the city of Vads√∏. However, in mid-September 2024, the Norwegian Migration Agency informed the man that he was not eligible for asylum and must leave the Schengen area within three weeks. This is the first known decision of this kind in Norway, writes The Barents Observer. According to the migration department, mobilization is not currently being carried out in Russia. Norwegian officials refer to the words of Vladimir Putin and Sergei Shoigu, who announced the completion of mobilization in October 2022. Suetin himself claims that the military commissariat continues to look for him even two years after the start of mobilization. According to the man, people from the military registration and enlistment office came to the apartment where he was registered and asked where he was. Suetin does not yet know what to do if the Norwegian authorities still force him to leave the country. -I'm sure, I know that I will be taken to war. I am of military age, I am not married, I have no children, I served in the army (although my military service consisted of removing snow and making the bed beautifully). Nowadays, it is not even necessary to serve a summons; it is enough to send it to the State Services - and the person is immediately deprived of the opportunity to leave the country. If I return to Russia, I will end up either in the army or in prison. Both options are tantamount to death.-Previously, Scandinavian countries have repeatedly refused political asylum to Russians. Thus, Russian Stanislav Brysin was refused asylum in Sweden, even despite his experience in holding protests and an open criminal case for -calls for terrorism.- At the beginning of the month, ASTRA wrote that in search of refuge, Brysin boarded a boat and sailed towards Ireland. Before this Sweden has deported a family from Belarus, against whom a criminal case has been opened in their homeland. The situation with shelters in the United States is no better. So, in material about American migration prisons ASTRA told the story of an opposition journalist from Russia with administrative punishment for -discrediting the army-, which US authorities deported to their homeland and handed over to the FSB.

Description: Explosions occurred in Zaporozhye. Russia probably attacked the city for the first time with updated Soviet FAB air bombsAt about 11 pm, explosions occurred in Zaporozhye. Shortly before this, the Ukrainian Air Force warned about the launch of guided missiles in the Zaporozhye region. After the explosions, there was no light in the city for some time, the public writes. In the comments, Telegram users noted that the sound of the explosions was remarkably loud. No other details were officially announced. Russian aviation for the first time successfully used a modernized version of Soviet FAB aerial bombs in the city, Ukrainian monitoring channels claim. Russia began actively using updated FABs in 2024. The FAB is equipped with UMPC complexes - wings and satellite guidance, which make the bomb adjustable and increase its range. As ASTRA previously wrote, such aerial bombs fell in the Russian Federation and the occupied territoriesof Ukraine more than a hundred times. Usually, such bombs do not explode when falling on Russian territory, however, on May 4, a FAB-500 fell on a house in Begorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars were damaged. The authorities chose to remain silent about the reason for the bomb's fall and its affiliation.

Title: ‚Ü©Ô∏èüñº A Ukrainian citizen has been held in a Volgograd migrant det...
Description: ASTRA: A Ukrainian citizen is deported from Russia for organizing the arrival of wheelchair users. A court in the Volgograd region found Ukrainian citizen Alexander Gongadze Free Ross guilty of violating the legislation on rallies and migration legislation.‚Ä¶ A Ukrainian citizen has been held in the Volgograd migrant detention center for more than two months. They cannot deport him to Ukraine because of the war and refuse to send him to Georgia to live with his relatives. In Russia, a man has a small child Alexander Ross is a native of Ukraine who has been living in Russia for the last 7 years. There, according to his common-law wife Lyudmila Burlakova, he was engaged in activism and social entrepreneurship, including helping the Russian military with his own money. -Sasha positions himself as Russian. I moved to Russia from Ukraine because persecution for pro-Russian views had already begun there,- Lyudmila Burlakova told ASTRA. The marriage of Lyudmila and Alexander is not officially registered, but they have a child together - two-year-old Fedor, born in the spring of 2022. Alexander Ross is listed as the father on the boy‚Äôs birth certificate (this and other documents mentioned in the news are at the disposal of the editors). They moved to the Volgograd region from Yekaterinburg during Lyudmila‚Äôs maternity leave: -My parents live here. Warm, sunny and lots of fruits and vegetables. The best choice for a child,- she explains. Ross has been in custody since the end of June. He wanted to draw attention to the state of pedestrian streets in the city of Kamyshin, by organizing a wheelchair race. The race was not allowed to take place - Ross was arrested for 9 days for organizing a public event without filing a notification (clause 2 of Article 20.2 of the Administrative Code).As ASTRA Lyudmila reported, Alexander Ross has been in custody since then. On July 6, police discovered that Ross had violated immigration laws. A year earlier, he and his wife flew to Egypt, and upon their return, Ross did not appear at the Ministry of Internal Affairs to provide his fingerprints and register. The couple did not know that upon leaving Russia, the man‚Äôs temporary registration was canceled. On September 20, the period of stay in the temporary detention center for migrants in Volgograd was once again extended by 90 days. They cannot deport him to Ukraine because of the war. The man also has relatives in Georgia, but the court refused to expel him to this country. -The conditions of detention are terrible, he sits in a solitary cell, without cellular communication. Sasha‚Äôs gums are swollen, he should go to the hospital, they don‚Äôt provide medical services, just pull out a tooth. Why pull out a healthy tooth if your gums swell due to a cold?-said Lyudmila in a conversation with ASTRA. In July, Lyudmila was fined for providing her common-law husband - and the father of her child - Alexander Ross with temporary registration for 2,000 rubles. -Where is the common sense of what is happening?-, asks the woman. According to her, Alexander has very low hemoglobin, she adds, after almost three months in prison he has become very weak and is already thinking about the subsequent rehabilitation of his common-law husband.-In fact, he is being held for nothing . Well, just think that he didn‚Äôt roll his fingers and take a photo. According to this article [part 1 of article 18.11. Code of Administrative Offenses] there is another punishment - a fine. No, in order to replenish the treasury with this fine, we take and imprison a person. And not only is the damage caused to everyone, including the individual, but it is also at the expense of the state. How much does each day cost at the migration center?-says Lyudmila.

Title: üñº Since the beginning of 2024, the Russian authorities have been...
Description: Russian authorities have been expecting an invasion of the Kursk region by the Armed Forces of Ukraine since the beginning of 2024 - The GuardianEdition references on documents of Russian military personnel confiscated by the Ukrainian army at abandoned positions in the Kursk region. It is alleged that Russian military commanders had been expecting a Ukrainian invasion of the Kursk region and had been making plans to prevent it for several months.The Guardian claims that their journalists met with a Ukrainian special forces team in late August that seized Russian documents The Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, the FSB and the Russian Army from buildings in the Kursk region after the invasion of the region by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Ukrainian military showed the documents and allowed the correspondents to photograph them. The earliest papers are dated to late 2023, the most recent were written six weeks before Ukraine began its invasion of the Kursk region on August 6. These are mainly reports on the situation and concerns in areas of the Kursk region from units of the 488th Guards Motorized Rifle Regiment of Russia, and in particular from the second company of its 17th battalion.The entry dated January 4 spoke of -potential breach of the state border- by Ukrainian armed groups and was ordered to intensify preparations to repel any attack. On February 19, unit commanders were warned about Ukrainian plans for a -rapid advance from the Sumy region into Russian territory to a depth of 80 km in order to create a four-day corridor before the arrival of the main units Ukrainian army on armored vehicles,- the publication writes.Allegedly, in mid-March, units on the border were ordered to strengthen defensive lines and -organize additional exercises to guide units and strong points on the proper organization of defense- in preparation for the Ukrainian invasion. In mid-June, a more specific warning appeared, as stated, about Ukrainian plans -in the direction of Yunakovka-Sudzha with the aim of taking Sudzha under control,- which happened in August. It was also assumed in advance that Ukraine would try to destroy the bridge across the river Sejm to disrupt Russian supply lines in the region. In a June document, the Russian military allegedly complained that units stationed at the front -are on average only 60-70% staffed and are mainly composed of reservists with poor training.-When the Ukrainian offensive began on August 6, many Russian soldiers abandoned their positions, and within a week Ukraine took full control of Sudzha. -They fled without even evacuating or destroying their documents,- said a member of the special team operations that seized the files, The Guardian claims.At the same time, the publication emphasizes that it could not independently verify the authenticity of the documents, -although they have signs of genuine messages from the Russian army.-

Since the legislation does not provide for such a measure of influence on Internet resources as -slowing down- in the current regulations, the resource itself, like the youtube domain name. com, at the beginning of August is not included in the list of prohibited or restricted access, authorized bodies and courts did not make a decision to restrict access to the platform, GRCHTS and Roskomnadzor do not have the right, on their own initiative, to take actions to restrict access to information-, - Rosteleset insists.

Description: Russian Denis Postovoy was arrested in the United States on charges of illegal supplies of microelectronics to Russia, which the Russian Federation could use to create a UAV44-year-old Denis Postovoy lived in Florida. Description: A resident of Norilsk was sent to a penal colony for six years for -fakes- about the armyThe Norilsk City Court sentenced local resident Sergei Kurylenko to six years in a general regime colony. He was found guilty of spreading -fake news- about the army and extremism, reports -OVD-Info-.Previously, Kurylenko was arrested in an administrative case for posts on Facebook. According to law enforcement agencies, they contained -derogatory statements about groups of people based on their social groups.- In them he talked about Russian soldiers and their mothers. Then Kurylenko admitted guilt and explained that he made publications to support relatives living in Ukraine.According to the prosecutor's office, Kurylenko was planning to leave Norilsk. Including, the department claims, he, being a native of Kiev, was considering moving to Ukraine.

Description: The European Parliament adopted a resolution calling to allow Ukrainian strikes deep into RussiaAt the plenary session in Strasbourg, 425 members of the European Parliament voted in favor, 131 voted against, 63 abstained. Description: -A modern Trojan horse.- The Mossad mined pagers for several years through front companies in Hungary, - New York TimesJournalists from The New York Times spoke with 12 current and former employees of the Israeli Ministry of Defense and Intelligence and told how an operation was being prepared. Description: Former Prime Minister of Chechnya called for Darwin's theory to be excluded from the school curriculumFormer Prime Minister of Chechnya, assistant to the Prime Minister of the Republic, Muslim Khuchiev, demanded to ban the teaching of Charles Darwin's theory of evolution in Russian schools. He stated this during the first meeting of the All-Russian Parents Committee, writes RBC.Khuchiev addressed the Russian Minister of Education Sergei Kravtsov with a corresponding proposal. According to the Chechen politician, Darwin's theory is erroneous, goes against religion and is the first step in the spiritual decay of children.-This is not true, it contradicts religious education, all religions have recognized this. Who else should admit this in order to remove it from textbooks and not put it into the consciousness of our children?-he said.Kravtsov has not yet responded to Khuchiev‚Äôs proposal.
